intro: Borreria fockeana, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a slightly hairy surface. Borreria fockeana is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
